tv.generator-info-name: Processed by Open-EPG Visual Processor v1.0

programme.title: Labor In Power
programme.sub-title: The Recession We Had To Have
programme.desc: This program analyses Australias move into recession in the late 1980s at a time of increasing conflict between the Prime Minister and the Treasurer over the leadership.

programme.title: Rage
programme.desc: Australias longest running music TV show, rage is home to the biggest vault of music videos from a diverse range of artists, genres and eras. We curate the best clips of all time to surprise and entertain you for hours.

programme.title: Gardening Australia
programme.desc: Tino Carnevale shares his familys passata-making tips; Millie Ross plants a cubby; Jane Edmanson meet young people whose lives have been changed by gardening and we explore the garden roles of bugs, guinea pigs and chooks.

programme.title: ABC News Mornings
programme.desc: Stay in the know with whats happening this morning. ABC News brings you up-to-the-minute news to fuel your daily conversations so you can stay connected and follow the discussion across the day. Presented by Gemma Veness.

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce and the team are back for a second visit to Beverley Minster in the East Riding of Yorkshire. Hundreds of visitors pack the nave eager to see the experts.

programme.title: Media Watch
programme.desc: Trumps attempt to neuter independent reporting at the Pentagon prompted a press walkout that didnt initially involve one Australian outlet. A podcast bust-up between an ABC star and a co-host tied to Melbournes underworld.

programme.title: Julia Zemiros Home Delivery
programme.desc: On a freezing day in a park in Manchester, Julia meets with broadcaster and scientist Brian Cox. They travel to his school, meet a favourite teacher, and talk about his career in music, physics and broadcasting.

programme.title: Long Lost Family
programme.desc: We meet Christine Gillard who for almost 50 years has lived with the pain of having given up her first born daughter, not once but twice. And Robert Lindsay, searching for the Croatian dad he has never met.

Sarah Ferguson presents Australias premier daily current affairs program, delivering agenda-setting journalism and interviews that hold the powerful to account. Plus analysis from 7.30s Political Editor Jacob Greber.

programme.title: Mother And Son
programme.desc: When Arthur breaks both his wrists in a fall, Maggie has to look after the son who usually looks after her... and in the process foils his attempt at instant internet fame.

programme.title: The Business
programme.desc: Australias leading daily business and finance show, bringing you up to date on market moves, economic trends and the forces affecting consumers, employees and business owners big and small. Presented by Kirsten Aiken.

programme.title: You Cant Ask That
programme.desc: Eight survivors from eight different disasters go back to the moment of impact, recalling exactly what happened, how they survived and ultimately where their lives are now.

programme.title: Rage
programme.desc: Australias longest running music TV show, rage is home to the biggest vault of music videos from a diverse range of artists, genres and eras. We curate the best clips of all time to surprise and entertain you for hours.

programme.title: Gardening Australia
programme.desc: Jane Edmanson visits a home full of indoor plants; Costa Georgiadis finds a roof garden on a block of flats; Sophie Thomson builds a wicking bed; Tino Carnevale discovers Antarctic gardening; and Millie Ross grows a seat.

programme.title: ABC News Mornings
programme.desc: Stay in the know with whats happening this morning. ABC News brings you up-to-the-minute news to fuel your daily conversations so you can stay connected and follow the discussion across today. Presented by Kathryn Robinson.

programme.title: End Game with Tony Armstrong
programme.desc: Tony Armstrong, the former AFL player turned award-winning broadcaster travels to the UK, as he starts a global search for solutions that could help drive systemic change back home.

programme.title: Restoration Australia
programme.desc: Carl and Jennie Palmer set about trying to recreate their Federation homesteads grandeur but finding the line between a functioning modern home and a heritage restoration is harder than they anticipate.

programme.title: Long Lost Family
programme.desc: We search on behalf of Peter Gunn, a man who has struggled to come to terms with his birth mother giving him up for adoption. And a man desperately searching for the sister who disappeared from his life over 60 years ago.

Sarah Ferguson presents Australias premier daily current affairs program, delivering agenda-setting journalism and interviews that hold the powerful to account. Plus analysis from 7.30s Political Editor Jacob Greber.

programme.title: Long Lost Family
programme.desc: Two incredible searches: a former Scotland footballer who searches for his mother after suffering a life-threatening brain tumour, and a woman pained with emotion on her wedding day because her birth mother was missing.

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: After recovering from leukaemia, musician Toby Leeming is driven to build five interlinked barn structures in a horseshoe around an old oak tree in Suffolk. But can he balance high architecture ambitions?

programme.title: Scooby-Doo And Guess Who?
programme.desc: The gang saves Weird Al Yankovic from a dinosaur.

programme.title: Rage Charts
programme.desc: Count down the hottest chart hits and catch up on some of the most promising new popular music videos on rage.

programme.title: We Bare Bears
programme.desc: The Bears audition to be the next mascot for their favourite cereal. They get so caught up in the process that their competitiveness gets the best of them.

programme.title: Operation Ouch!
programme.desc: The Ouch Taxi is on the road once again, as the Doctors celebrate the Outstanding, Unbelievable, Caring and Heroic achievements of this years finalists, and reveal the winners.

programme.title: ABC Family Programs Resume At 7.30pm
programme.desc: ABC Family programs resume at 7:30pm.

programme.title: Shaun The Sheep
programme.desc: The Farmer is preparing for a date! He wants to look his best so its time to dust off his prized hairpiece. Shaun cant resist trying the wig on but loses it while showing off to the flock.

programme.title: Operation Ouch!
programme.desc: If a lifetimes worth of tears fell in one MASSIVE drop, what would it look like? Dr Xand does a poo for the benefit of science. And minds are bent by street artist Xandsy!

programme.title: Fresh Off The Boat
programme.desc: Jessica gets upset when the latest season of "Melrose Place" ends. To fulfill her need for drama, she goes snooping for secrets about Deidre. Meanwhile, Louis and Eddie help Emery find a way to channel negative emotions.

programme.title: Operation Ouch!: Do Try This At Home
programme.desc: Dr Chris and Dr Xand are back in their kitchen lab! In this episode, the doctors take a close look at teeth, and show you what happens to them when you eat and drink.

programme.title: Rage
programme.desc: Keep the party vibe going as the sun comes up with continuous music videos, from new releases to classics and the songs weve long forgotten.

programme.title: Miraculous: Tales Of Ladybug And Cat Noir
programme.desc: When one of Shadow Moths favourite victims is akumatized into Penalteam, a fearsome team of supervillains, Ladybug calls on her own superheroes to face her. May the best team win!

programme.title: ABC Kids Programs Resume At 4am
programme.desc: ABC Kids programs resume at 4.00am

programme.title: Shaun The Sheep
programme.desc: The sheep discover a set of bagpipes on the rubbish dump, which they immediately misidentify as a sick emu. They set about trying to nurse it back to health before releasing it back into the wild.

programme.title: Operation Ouch!
programme.desc: Dr Xand has been recording his farts. But why is it they sound so different? And we meet two of our brilliant new Ouchers!

programme.title: Secrets Of The Zoo
programme.desc: The keepers make their early morning breakfast rounds at the Heart of Africa exhibit.

programme.title: L.A. Confidential
programme.desc: Los Angeles, 1953. Beneath the glamorous veneer of Hollywood lies a crime-ridden city corrupt to its core. While investigating a brutal murder, three very different detectives will rediscover a common bond of integrity.

programme.title: Operation Ouch!
programme.desc: The Doctors are Ouch and About ready for your medical questions, and Dr Xand turns fire juggler to reveal your secret sense - proprioception. But will Chris notice that somethings up?

programme.title: Be Cool, Scooby-Doo!
programme.desc: To solve the mystery of a creepy Crystal Crawler - a bat-like cave monster - the Gang must venture into the Crystal Canopy - a labyrinth of intricate crystal formations.

programme.title: The Deep
programme.desc: Mad Madeline steals the dangerous Sceptre of Queen Dorius! The Nektons find her, but she loses the sceptre! To get it back, Ant must face his fear of sawfish, aka fish with a hedge-trimmer on their face!

programme.title: The Powerpuff Girls
programme.desc: When a monster ruins their relaxing vacation, the Girls run into a familiar face.

programme.title: Teen Titans Go!
programme.desc: In this episode of "Turbo Titans Go Force", the Titans gain the ability to transform into cars.

programme.title: Odd Squad
programme.desc: When Omar catches a case of Clown-i-tosis, Orla must keep track of him in the van before he runs off to join the circus. Meanwhile, Opal and Oswald trek through the Odd Woods to find the ingredients for the antidote.

programme.title: Operation Ouch!
programme.desc: The Doctors reveal the incredible discs that protect your spine in a giant crane experiment, and prepare for some massive snotting!

programme.title: Horrible Science
programme.desc: Big Danny and Big Manny find science shocking, Da Vinci does a sound experiment, Newton rides again, Queen Vic shows off and Dr Big Brain doesnt see the attraction of electromagnets!

programme.title: Phil Spencer: Secret Agent
programme.desc: Phil travels to Tunstall in Kent, to the country cottage of Sarah Sewells and Andrew Morris. The couple bought the house two years ago, but with marriage on the horizon, theyd love to move to a bigger family house.

programme.title: George Clarkes Amazing Spaces
programme.desc: We begin with a trip to the canals, as George travels to Dudley, where eccentric carpenter Sam is switching his life as a tenant for freedom on the water with a narrow-boat he bought for 5000 pounds.

programme.title: Unforgotten
programme.desc: The Bishop Street team investigate Gerry Coopers life and criminal record, making contact with his widow, Juliet. Darker layers to the suspects lives are revealed.

programme.title: ER
programme.desc: Its Thanksgiving and the ER treat an animal rights activist who was attacked by the turkey he was trying to save. Doctors help a suicidal transgender woman and try to save two boys who killed a girl in a car accident.

programme.title: rage Vault: Tamra Davis
programme.desc: From Lou Reed to Bette Midler, Sonic Youth, Hanson, Ben Lee, Beastie Boys and more, rage lines up the best clips directed by Tamra Davis.

programme.title: Payback
programme.desc: They took his money. They took his wife. And they tried to take his life. Now its time for payback as one man starts his own personal war against the syndicate in this hard-edged thriller.

programme.title: Heartbreak High
programme.desc: Bolton tries to prevent the closing of his uncles bowling alley but receives little help from his friends.

programme.title: Be Cool, Scooby-Doo!
programme.desc: Daphne brings the gang to a Victorian murder mystery party, so they can dress up and solve a fake mystery for once.

programme.title: The Deep
programme.desc: The Nektons help locate a legendary Singaporean glass cabinet, but discover its guarded by a terrifying and familiar creature! Last time, they barely escaped with their lives! Will they be as lucky this time around?

programme.title: The Powerpuff Girls
programme.desc: The Girls have to battle Him after he causes Bubbles imagination to run wild.

programme.title: Teen Titans Go!
programme.desc: In the exciting conclusion of "Turbo Titans Go Force", the Titans must learn to work together to stop Dr. Military.

programme.title: Alphablocks
programme.desc: Five little Alphablocks are jumping on the bed, can Ls lullaby get them to sleep? This episode introduces the letter L and the words log, lid, bed, ted, hug, cot, nap and lips.

programme.title: Horrible Histories
programme.desc: Life wasnt always fun for children in the past. Horrible Histories delves into the not-so-easy lives of children throughout history, from the strict parenting of ancient civilisations, to the terrible sibling fights.

programme.title: The Ancient World
programme.desc: Explores the rise and fall of Ancient China and the Shang Dynasty, and their inventions that helped shape the modern world.

programme.title: Phil Spencer: Secret Agent
programme.desc: Phil comes to the rescue of grandmother Elaine Care, whose four bedroom semi in Folkestone has been on the market for a whopping two years.

programme.title: George Clarkes Amazing Spaces
programme.desc: George meets an old friend in Norfolk who sees the potential in the most unpromising of spaces - an old sewage works.

programme.title: Planet America
programme.desc: Trump mulls a land attack on Venezuela after admitting he sent in the CIA. Millions march against Trump in No Kings rallies, the government shutdown drags on, plus John Bolton pleads not guilty but George Santos walks free.

programme.title: ER
programme.desc: The ER goes from completely empty to jammed beyond capacity during a chaotic snowstorm that caused a 32-car expressway pileup. Ross and Linda return from the Caribbean just as Carol makes a surprise announcement.

programme.title: Moon And Me
programme.desc: Today, Moon Baby is going to visit Mr Onions bridge. Mr Onion is very excited, waiting for his friend. When Moon Baby arrives, Mr Onion hurries to meet him. But, where has Moon Baby gone?

programme.title: Beep And Mort
programme.sub-title: The Mysterious Honk In The Fog
programme.desc: Beep and Mort go for a fun day out on Clems boat. Its a foggy day so they need the lighthouse to help find the way home. Bump! What was that? Looks like someone else is lost! Could it be a cute baby fog creature?

programme.title: Hoopla Doopla!
programme.desc: Bops job is to wind the town clock before everyone wakes up. He decides to move the clock forward so his friends wake up earlier and morning tea will be earlier, but everyone in Hoopla relies on the clock being on time.

programme.title: The Sound Collector
programme.desc: The Sound Collector discovers that music and sound can change how you feel.

programme.title: Bing
programme.desc: Bing goes to play with Sula who is engrossed in a game of sparkle magic when he arrives. Bing wants to play too but Sula finds all sorts of reasons why Bing cant play with her special sparkly things.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Peppa and George are playing in their tree-house. Peppas friends come to play but Peppa decides that only girls can come into the tree-house. So, Grandpa Pig builds the boys their very own den shaped like a castle.

programme.title: Shaun The Sheep
programme.desc: Everyone is settling down for the night, when Bitzer begins to act strangely - he just cant sit still. When his peculiar behaviour starts spreading around the Flock, Shaun decides he must find out whats causing it.

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: At a picnic on Annies farm, Peter comes up with a series of games that almost lead to disaster! Meanwhile, Lizzie and Jodie search for a rare seal.

programme.title: Ben And Hollys Little Kingdom
programme.desc: Holly breaks her wand and must go to the Wand Factory, at the bottom of the Great Elf Tree, to get it fixed.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Peppa and George help Grandpa Pig build a special bird watching hut so that they can spot an owl at night.

programme.title: Kangaroo Beach
programme.desc: A day at the lake turns into chaos when Frizzy and Spyke become convinced theres a monster toad prowling the lake, the Cadets must uncover the truth behind the mysterious phantom frog.

programme.title: Super Monsters
programme.desc: The Super Monsters discover Grrbus can fly, turning a messy cleanup into an exciting lesson in teamwork and surprises.

programme.title: Nikhil and Jay
programme.sub-title: Nikhil and Jay and the Lollipop Swap
programme.desc: When Nikhil and Jay think they have broken Nanas lollipop stick, they decide to make her a new one. But how can they make sure Nana likes it?

programme.title: Ready Eddie Go!
programme.desc: Eddie goes to the cinema with Akil and Nina, learning to enjoy himself even when it gets a little noisy.

programme.title: Play School Science Time
programme.desc: Can you make ice cream without a freezer? In this very cool experiment, Michelle learns how different temperatures can help her make ice cream in a bag, using milk and ice cubes!

programme.title: Fizzy And Suds
programme.desc: Fizzy and Suds follow a garbage truck, watching bins lifted and rubbish shaken, and see how recycling turns trash into something completely new.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Peppa and her family have been on a trip to a mountain beauty spot. When Daddy Pig loses the car keys down a drain Mr Bull offers to find them with his digger...

programme.title: Millie Magnificent
programme.desc: Millie and the Creato-crew make some doggo-muffs for Wallace so he wont be left out of the fireworks celebration in the park.

programme.title: Stan Can
programme.desc: Benjamin and Sophie have a new friend, Coco the bug. Ari asks Stanley to help build a bug feeder, but it soon runs out of food when a few more of Cocos bug friends turn up.

programme.title: PJ Masks
programme.desc: The PJMs defeat the Ninjas with ease, and become over-confident in their powers. But Night Ninjas secretly plotting to acquire PJ powers for himself.

programme.title: Thomas And Friends: Big World! Big Adventures!
programme.desc: Bulgy thinks that people should travel by bus instead of rail until he learns that having so many passengers is not so easy for the buses on their own.

programme.title: Gardening Australia Junior
programme.desc: Costa and the junior gardeners plant a rainbow veggie patch FULL of different coloured veggies.

programme.title: Wiggle And Learn
programme.desc: Explore musical dynamics with The Wiggles! Join with Evie as she teaches Captain Feathersword about the importance of volume and tone.

programme.title: Super Monsters
programme.desc: Katya struggles to choose the perfect fruit punch for the Blue Moon party, but with her friends help, she creates a magical drink that everyone loves.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Miss Rabbits train has broken down with a carriage full of passengers who need to get to work. Grandpa Pig lends Miss Rabbit his little train Gertrude.

programme.title: PJ Masks Power Heroes
programme.desc: Bastet and Pharaoh Boy lose their tempers with each other which Romeo exploits.

programme.title: The Adventures Of Paddington
programme.desc: Jonathan Judy and Paddington accidentally break Mrs. Birds much-loved rocking chair! How will they fix it before she finds out?

programme.title: Ben And Hollys Little Kingdom
programme.desc: Ben Elf and his parents are going on holiday in the elf truck but Gaston, the Ladybird, has swallowed the car keys! Ben and Holly take Gaston to the vet to retrieve the keys.

programme.title: Rocket Club
programme.desc: Jeenie is pumped to send Rocket Club on an exploration of a Blue Hole on Oceania, but then has to scramble to save them when a giant space-squid attacks!

programme.title: Moon And Me
programme.desc: Colly Wobble finds an upside-down crown in the curiosity box and decides to play being the Upside Down Princess. In Storyland, everybody visits the Upside-Down Castle for a Upside-Down tea with the Upside-Down Princess.

programme.title: Beep And Mort
programme.desc: Rafs trying to say something important, so Beep updates her system to dog to understand. But oh no! Now Beep can only speak dog! Raf and Beep visit the mysterious land of the lost things to try to find Beeps robot voice.

programme.title: Hoopla Doopla!
programme.desc: Ziggy orders a a special magic cloak that will make him invisible, but when the cloak doesnt work his friends pretend that they cant see him.

programme.title: The Sound Collector
programme.desc: When the Sound Collector hears a mysterious sound, he sets off to find out what it is.

programme.title: Bing
programme.desc: Bing and Pando are in the sandpit pretending to be diggers. Bing wants to dig the biggest hole and gets upset when Pando accidentally fills it in.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Mr Zebra the Postman is delivering the post and today his daughter Zoe is helping him. Zoe has a very special letter for Peppa and George; an invitation to her birthday party.

programme.title: Shaun The Sheep
programme.desc: When the Farmer discovers hes sprung a leak, he calls the Water Board to come and fix the problem. The bored Flock are thrilled by the opportunity to have some watery fun. When the workmen clock off, the party begins!

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: Sarah and Mandy are filming a piece for the Scoop Dooley Show, and Scoop Dooley is trying to make everything more sensational.

programme.title: Ben And Hollys Little Kingdom
programme.desc: Holly is going on a camping trip with Ben and his mum and dad, but they are soon joined by annoying Mr Gnome, who is always hungry and sings silly songs.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Peppa and family enjoy their garden apple tree all year round, through Spring, Summer, Autumn and Winter.

programme.title: Kangaroo Beach
programme.desc: The cadets pair up with a Junior Junior Cadet to show the importance of always swimming with a buddy, but Frizzy gets carried away with the theatrics of it all and forgets what it takes to be a good buddy.

programme.title: Super Monsters
programme.desc: Zoe and Frankie solve a garden mystery, learning teamwork and care for the environment.

programme.title: Nikhil and Jay
programme.sub-title: Nikhil and Jay and the Maxs Friend
programme.desc: When Max the cat leaves the garden in the middle of a game, the boys are shocked to learn she might have other friends! They find clues to try and find where Max has gone.

programme.title: Ready Eddie Go!
programme.desc: Eddie makes hair washing fun by discovering some thinking tricks as part of the bath time routine.

programme.title: Play School Science Time
programme.desc: Why do some things fall faster? Were reaching new heights to find out why some items fall faster than others. Join Alex as he creates a parachute for a toy dinosaur using a serviette.

programme.title: Fizzy And Suds
programme.desc: Fizzy and Suds visit an observatory to explore our planets! They see how planets orbit the Sun, what theyre made of, and theres a special trip to Mars!

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Miss Rabbits train has broken down with a carriage full of passengers who need to get to work. Grandpa Pig lends Miss Rabbit his little train Gertrude.

programme.title: Millie Magnificent
programme.desc: When Millie accidentally loses Little Miss Fluffkins while pet-sitting the class pet, she must search high and low for the little hamster.

programme.title: Stan Can
programme.desc: Huge, knitted sculptures are appearing all around town. A giant cupcake on Hatties cafe, oversized knitted fruit and vegetables on top of Joses shop and a massive cardigan on the school.

programme.title: PJ Masks
programme.desc: Gekkos looking forward to being a pirate in a school play but his thunder is stolen by a pirate villain. Gekko wants to catch the villain but really wants to prove hes the best pirate too!

programme.title: Thomas And Friends: Big World! Big Adventures!
programme.desc: When Rebecca works with the Troublesome Trucks everyone expects the worst, but Rebecca defies expectations and has a very chucklesome day.

programme.title: Gardening Australia Junior
programme.desc: Hannah and Frida make a butterfly cafe to attract more winged creatures to their garden.

programme.title: Wiggle And Learn
programme.desc: Join Lachy and Simon for some rhyming fun, then Do the Propeller with The Wiggles as we explore planes and sing along!

programme.title: Super Monsters
programme.desc: Zoes excitement spoils the Super Monsters game, but her friends turn it into a chance to help her practice her powers, teaching teamwork, patience, and friendship.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Mummy Pig finds a spider in the house and orders Daddy Pig to get rid of it. Mr Skinny-Legs is set free in the garden, where he can spin all the webs he likes, wherever he likes.

programme.title: PJ Masks Power Heroes
programme.desc: Catboy finds organising the expanded team difficult, and wants to do stuff solo. But he ends up becoming an easy target for Romeo...

programme.title: The Adventures Of Paddington
programme.desc: On the last day of the school holidays Jonathan and Judy cant agree on what to do so Paddington has the casting vote.

programme.title: Ben And Hollys Little Kingdom
programme.desc: A magical card arrives in the Little Kingdom, inviting everyone to a party at Granny and Granpapa Thistles castle. The party is full of wonderful surprises and Granpapa shows everyone his funny hobbies.

programme.title: Rocket Club
programme.desc: Jeenie and Chip secretly cultivate a seed from Bunnys home planet that quickly becomes a gigantic plant with a voracious appetite for mayhem.

programme.title: Labor In Power
programme.sub-title: The Recession We Had To Have
programme.desc: This program analyses Australias move into recession in the late 1980s at a time of increasing conflict between the Prime Minister and the Treasurer over the leadership.

programme.title: ABC Late News
programme.desc: Know the latest on the days top stories, as Michael Tetlow brings you a comprehensive roundup of the news of the day. ABC News has reporters across Australia and around the globe reporting on the issues that matter to you.

programme.title: ABC Late News
programme.desc: Follow the latest on todays news, covering whats happening and why it matters. ABC News has reporters across Australia and around the globe to bring you the news you need to know. Presented by Michael Tetlow in Perth.

programme.title: The Breakfast Couch
programme.desc: Julia Roberts chats about her new movie After The Hunt, Channing Tatum and Kirsten Dunst talk about their film Roofman with critic Zak Hepburn, plus Rosie ODonnell, Good Charlottes Joel Madden and singer Fanny Lumsden.

Sarah Ferguson presents Australias premier daily current affairs program, delivering agenda-setting journalism and interviews that hold the powerful to account. Plus analysis from 7.30s Political Editor Jacob Greber.

programme.title: Australian Story
programme.sub-title: Ride Of Her Life - Saya Sakakibara
programme.desc: BMX golden girl Saya Sakakibara dreamed of sharing Olympic glory with her brother Kai. When a racing accident almost took his life, Saya had to overcome crippling fear and ride for both of them.

programme.title: ABC News Mornings
programme.desc: Stay in the know with whats happening this morning. ABC News brings you up-to-the-minute news to fuel your daily conversations so you can stay connected and follow the discussion across the day. Presented by Gemma Veness.

programme.title: National Press Club Address
programme.desc: Dr Daniel Timms, a biomedical engineer committed to developing cutting-edge cardiovascular medical devices including the total automatic heart (TAH) and advancing cardiac care, addresses the National Press Club.

programme.title: ABC News Afternoons
programme.desc: More news, more often. Wherever you are stay in touch with ABC News through the day. We have reporters in more places, to tell you whats happening and why it matters. Ros Childs brings you the latest news and information.

programme.desc: Theres never been a more important time for transparency and trust. ABC News brings you the days top stories and latest news, with more reporters to tell you whats going on and why it matters. Presented by Lorna Dunkley.

programme.desc: The latest breaking news and a comprehensive roundup of the days top stories from across Australias states and regions. With reporters in more places ABC News tells the stories that matter to you. Presented by Manny Tsigas.

programme.desc: Theres never been a more important time to stay in touch with whats happening in our world. Yvonne Yong presents the latest international news from ABC News correspondents as well as interviews with experts and guests.
